business.headline: IMF praises UPI, says it makes India global leader in fast paymentUnified Payments Interface is an instant and real-time payment system developed by NPCI to facilitate inter-bank transactions through mobile phones.
Sensex closes 346 points lower, Nifty below 25,400; Airtel down 3%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 345.80 points to end at 83,190.28, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 120.85 points to close at 25,355.25.

Dubai dreams under scanner as ED questions homebuyers: ReportMany of the individuals who bought property in Dubai are now under scrutiny as they failed to provide proper bank transaction records showing how the payments were made.

8th Pay Commission may hike salaries by 30–34%: ReportThe 8th Pay Commission could benefit around 11 million people, including about 4.4 million central government employees and nearly 6.8 million pensioners. Once approved, the changes will raise their basic pay, allowances, and retirement benefits.

Will ITR filing deadline be extended again? Here's why it mightIn May, the CBDT announced extending the ITR filing deadline, citing big changes in the forms and system readiness. It said that the updated ITRs will make compliance simpler and reporting more transparent for taxpayers.

Zepto, Blinkit, Instamart face a new rival in Delhi's 10-min delivery warThe move brings the e-commerce giant into direct competition with local players such as Blinkit (owned by Eternal), Swiggy Instamart and Zepto, who already dominate the quick delivery space.

Smartworks Coworking Spaces IPO open for bidding: Should you subscribe?The bidding window for the IPO will remain open until Monday, July 14. Investors can place bids within the price band of Rs 387 to Rs 407 per share.

When nursery fees need an EMI: CoinSwitch co-founder flags new middle-class crisisOnce believed to be the key to a better life, schooling today has ironically become the heaviest expense for India's middle-class families, who are struggling to keep up, says Ashish Singhal, co-founder of CoinSwitch.

Nvidia now worth nearly as much as India's economy. Details hereAccording to the International Monetary Fund (IMF), India's gross domestic product is currently estimated at $4.2 trillion and is expected to touch $4.27 trillion by the end of 2025.

3 key reasons behind Bitcoin's record high todayAt the time of writing, Bitcoin is trading at $111,019.74, rising by 2.27% over the past day. The last record was set on May 22 when it briefly touched $111,970. Since then, Bitcoin has had a bumpy ride, but it seems to be back with a bang.

TCS to announce Q1 results today: Here's what to expect from the IT giantTCS Q1 results: Apart from growth numbers, the market will also watch for any announcements on interim dividends, updates on client budgets in sectors like banking, retail, and manufacturing, and comments on the pace of new deal wins.
Sensex opens 85 points higher, Nifty above 25,400; Tata Steel up 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 43.60 points to 83,492.48, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 15.90 points to 25,460.20 as of 9:28 am.

entertainment.headline: Hailee Steinfeld, Miles Teller star in Paramount's Winter Games rom-comParamount's Winter Games stars Hailee Steinfeld and Miles Teller in a rom-com set during the Olympics. The film adds to Steinfeld's busy year, including marriage, a hit thriller, and new music.

Justin Bieber returns with new album 'Swag'  after 4 years of break Justin Bieber is set to release his new album Swag, marking his musical comeback after four years, featuring high-profile collaborations and global teasers that have fuelled fan anticipation.

Kanye West sued by ex-assistant for sexual assault and traffickingLauren Pisciotta has sued Kanye West, accusing him of sexual assault, harassment, and trafficking. She details disturbing incidents, including oral rape and stalking, escalating after she rejected his advances.

Kichcha Sudeep announces K47: I feel the need to bring out a film this yearKannada actor Kichcha Sudeep announced his forty-seventh film, tentatively titled 'K47' with 'Max' director Vijay Kartikeya. During the press conference he revealed that he aims to release the film in December 2025.

When Saif Ali Khan told Sharmila Tagore he doesn't want her, recalls Soha Ali KhanActor Soha Ali Khan recently recalled that as a working mother, Sharmila Tagore didn't see Saif Ali Khan for weeks during his childhood. She mentioned how Saif would get upset with mother Sharmila when she came to meet him.

Here's why Sunny Deol has only 15-minute screen time as Lord Hanuman in RamayanaNitesh Tiwari's 'Ramayana: Part 1', featuring Ranbir Kapoor and Yash, will release during Diwali 2026. Sunny Deol as Lord Hanuman will have a limited role in the first part with a bigger part in the 2027 sequel, promising a grand spectacle.

The Paradise: Raghav Juyal joins Nani's film, makers share BTS clip on his birthdayOn Raghav Juyal's birthday, the makers of Nani's 'The Paradise' officially welcomed him to the cast with a BTS video. In the clip, director Srikanth Odela teased Juyal's dark and brutal character.

Priyanka Chopra reacts to hot dog vs vada pav backlash: It's not that seriousPriyanka Chopra sparked an online debate after choosing hot dog over vada pav during a rapid-fire food round at her film premiere. Reacting to the backlash, she said, "It's not that serious," reminding fans not to overthink her food choices.

Family refuses to accept Pakistani actor Humaira Asghar Ali's bodyPakistani actor Humaira Asghar Ali was found dead in her locked Karachi apartment, with reports suggesting she had died nearly three weeks earlier. Her family's refusal to claim the body has sparked widespread shock and prompted authorities to step in for her final rites.

Exclusive: Madhavan explains why some men are seen as toxic despite good intentionsActor Madhavan opened up about how men are perceived as toxic despite good intentions. In an exclusive conversation with India Today, he highlighted the confusion men face adapting to new ways of respecting women in modern society.

Payal Rohatgi-Sangram Singh shut down divorce rumours with anniversary celebrationAmid divorce rumours, Payal Rohatgi and Sangram Singh clarified that they are still together and celebrated their third wedding anniversary recently. Sangram dismissed the speculation, saying they have been together for 14 years and will always be.

Vikrant Massey on playing Sri Sri Ravi Shankar: I can only attempt to be himVikrant Massey opened up about meeting Sri Sri Ravi Shankar ahead of filming the biopic 'White'. The film will showcase the spiritual leader's role in Colombia's civil war resolution and his wider contributions.

Baahubali turns 10: How it went from disaster talks to achieving Tollywood gloryWhen 'Baahubali: The Beginning' released in 2015, the stakes were sky-high and expectations even higher. But what began with disaster talks in the Telugu states soon evolved into a cultural reset, one that would shape the trajectory of Indian cinema for the next decade.
Top films and shows to watch on Netflix this weekendFrom love stories and suspense thrillers to reality shows and family dramas, here's what you can watch on Netflix this weekend.

Firing at Kapil Sharma's newly opened cafe in CanadaUnidentified gunmen opened fire at the building housing comedian Kapil Sharma's cafe, Kap's Cafe, in Surrey, Canada. The cafe was recently launched and pictures have gone viral. The attackers reportedly arrived in a car and fled soon after. No one was injured in the incident.  Unidentified gunmen opened fire at the building housing comedian Kapil Sharma's cafe, Kap's Cafe, in Surrey, Canada. The cafe was recently launched and pictures have gone viral. The attackers reportedly arrived in a car and fled soon after. No one was injured in the incident. 
Khalistani terrorist Harjeet Singh Laddi has taken responsibility for this attack. Ladddi is the most wanted terrorist of India's NIA and is associated with BKI (Babbar Khalsa International).

The Society trailer: Bigg Boss meets Squid Game in Munawar's new show Munawar Faruqui's new show, 'The Society', appears to draw inspiration from 'Bigg Boss', 'Lock Upp' and 'Squid Game'. The reality show is slated to premiere on OTT platform on July 21.

Oho Enthan Baby review: A funny, feel-good drama that falls prey to clichesRelease Date:Thu Jul 10, 2025Oho Enthan Baby movie review: Directed by Krishnakumar Ramkumar, 'Oho Enthan Baby', starring Rudra and Mithila Palkar, is a feel-good romantic drama that loses grip in its second half. With a gripping first half and glorious meta references, it manages to entertain mostly, before falling prey to clichés.

Firing at Kapil Sharma's cafe in Canada, Khalistani terrorist claims responsibilityHarjeet Singh Laddi, one of the most-wanted terrorists listed by National Investigation Agency (NIA), has claimed responsibility for the attack on Kapil Sharma's cafe in Canada.

Dexter Resurrection OTT release: When and where to watch in IndiaPrime Video will debut the mystery series 'Dexter: Resurrection' in India on July 12, featuring stars like Michael C Hall, Peter Dinklage, and Uma Thurman. It coincides with Amazon's Prime Day celebrations.

general news.headline: Trump slaps 35% tariff on Canada, plans up to 20% on remaining nationsTrump has already sent letters to 22 countries outlining new tariff rates, including a 50% tariff on imports from Brazil. He warned that any retaliation would be met with even higher tariffs.

Root shines as England trade Bazball's riffs for restraint on Day 1 at Lord'sENG vs IND, 3rd Test: England adopted a cautious batting approach on Day 1 of the third Test against India at Lord's. This shift surprised many as England scored 251 runs at 3.02 runs per over on a tricky pitch.

Irresponsible: Centre slams Bhagwant Mann for jibe at PM's foreign visitsWithout naming Bhagwant Mann, the Ministry of External Affairs said that the comments made by a "high state authority" are "irresponsible and regrettable".

Iga Swiatek ends agonising wait for final, sets up clash with AnisimovaWimbledon: Iga Swiatek advanced to the final of the grass court major after demolishing Belinda Bencic in straight sets in the semi-final on Thursday on Centre Court.

Firing at Kapil Sharma's cafe in Canada, Khalistani terrorist claims responsibilityHarjeet Singh Laddi, one of the most-wanted terrorists listed by National Investigation Agency (NIA), has claimed responsibility for the attack on Kapil Sharma's cafe in Canada.

FIR reveals father killed tennis player Radhika Yadav over taunts, academy disputeNational tennis player Radhika Yadav was shot dead by her father at their Gurugram home. He confessed to the murder, citing anger over her tennis academy and public remarks.

We'll charge 50%: Brazil's Lula threatens Trump after hefty tariff announcementLula also said that Brazil might turn to the World Trade Organisation (WTO) to resolve the matter. He stressed that Brazil has a legal tool ready to respond -- the Reciprocity Law, recently passed by Brazil's Congress.

The world from Modi's window seat: Tracking PM's flight around the planetThe PM's meetings and events on the ground have been widely covered. But what did his journey look like in the sky? What must Modi have seen from his window?

Justin Bieber returns with new album 'Swag'  after 4 years of break Justin Bieber is set to release his new album Swag, marking his musical comeback after four years, featuring high-profile collaborations and global teasers that have fuelled fan anticipation.

Unforgettable, I got whacked: Trump recalls 2024 assassination bidTrump says he's "satisfied" with the probe into last year's assassination attempt in Pennsylvania, admitting the Secret Service "had a bad day." Six agents were suspended as security reforms roll out.

With Cummins lessons, Nitish Reddy hoping to get name on Lord's honour boardNitish Kumar Reddy revealed the lessons he learnt from Pat Cummins about bowling in England and his dream putting his name on the Lord's honours board. Nitish was the pick of the bowlers on Day 1 of the third Test against England.

Pro-Tamil party holds rare meeting with hundreds of cattle, raises land demandsNaam Tamilar Katchi held a one-of-a-kind conference in Madurai attended by hundreds of cattle, demanding restoration of grazing lands and spotlighting farmers' issues.

Wink, wine and Windsor: Macron's moment with Kate Middleton goes viralAs the cameras rolled during a formal toast at the July 8 gala dinner, Macron was spotted winking at the Princess of Wales - a blink-and-miss gesture that quickly went viral on social media.

Boring: Shubman Gill lands brutal dig at England's slowest session in Bazball eraENG vs IND: India captain Shubman Gill openly criticised England's cautious batting on Day 1 of the third Test at Lord's. England scored at less than three runs per over in the second session.

Shubhanshu Shukla to undock from Space Station on July 14: NasaThe Axiom-4 mission was launched from the Kennedy Space Centre in Florida on June 25. Now, astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla and three other crew members are set to return to Earth from the International Space Station on July 14, NASA said.

Columbia activist Mahmoud Khalil sues Trump administration for $20 millionMahmoud Khalil, a Palestinian-American activist and recent Columbia University graduate, has filed a USD 20 million claim against the Trump administration over false imprisonment and political retaliation.

Watch: Car stunt at tourist hotspot ends in 300-foot fall in MaharashtraA man was critically injured after his car fell into a 300-foot gorge during a stunt at Karad's Table Point, a popular but unsafe tourist spot lacking safety measures.

High Court pauses release of Udaipur Files until government reviews ban pleaThe Delhi High Court said that the government has the authority to determine whether the release of the film should be permitted under Section 6 of the Cinematograph Act.

UK's F-35 jet, stuck in Kerala since June 14, may fly back home next week: ReportThe fifth-generation stealth aircraft, among the most advanced and expensive fighter jets in the world, costing upwards of $115 million, has remained grounded at Thiruvananthapuram International Airport since June 14.

No more 'Sir': Bangladesh scraps Hasina-era rule for addressing women officialsBangladesh's interim government has officially cancelled a controversial rule from the Hasina era that required female officials to be addressed as "Sir." A new committee will review titles and suggest gender-appropriate alternatives.

Tulsi's return is good news for all. Kyunki saas bhi kabhi viewer thiKyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi, which was the flagship of the K-phenomenon in India, hooked women, saas and bahu alike, for years. Those viewers have been starved of content, with some taking to Pakistani serials, as the OTT-driven entertainment industry moved on to crime and real-life dramas. Tulsi Virani's return is good for viewers, Smriti Irani, who played the protagonist, and the overall content industry.

Top Ukrainian spy assassinated in broad daylight in Kyiv, shooter on the runSecurity footage circulating on social media shows a man leaving a residential building and walking toward a parking lot. Another man approaches him and fires several shots before running away. An official said that the victim was a colonel in the Security Service of Ukraine (SBU).

One way or another: Netanyahu vows to eliminate Hamas if ceasefire talks collapseSpeaking from Washington in a video message at the end of what he called a 'historic visit' following war against Iran, Netanyahu outlined the balance between diplomacy and military resolve as Israel seeks to dismantle Hamas's military structure.

Bangladesh saw nearly 2,500 communal attacks in 330 days, minorities demand justiceThe nature of violence ranged from murders and sexual assaults, including gang rapes, to attacks on places of worship, seizing homes and more, the statement said.

Sabalenka admitted that she has a hate relationship with Wimbledon now after losing the semi-final to Amanda Anisimova on Thursday, July 10.

BCCI put out the new rule in the aftermath of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy debacle.

Injury scare for Rishabh Pant at Lord's. Can replacement Dhruv Jurel bat if needed?ENG vs IND: India's Rishabh Pant injured his finger while fielding in the third Test at Lord's. Dhruv Jurel substituted him with the gloves in the second session on Day 1.

Watch: India captain Gill speaks Telugu to praise golden arm man Nitish ReddyIndia captain Shubman Gill praised Nitish Kumar Reddy in Telugu after the Indian all-rounder's fantastic spell during the first session of the Lord's Test. Nitish broke the game open for India with two quick wickets.

Shreyanka Patil returns as India A name squads for Australia tourShreyanka Patil has been picked in the T20 squad as India A named their squads for the multi-format tour of Australia. Radha Yadav will lead the visitors with Minnu Mani as her deputy.

Arsenal complete signing of Brentford captain Christian NorgaardArsenal have completed the signing of Brentford captain Christian Norgaard in a bid to shore up their midfield on Thursday, July 10. Norgaard joins Arsenal after spending six seasons at Brentford.

Captain Shubman Gill shines as Nitish Reddy gamble pays off at Lord'sEngland vs India, Lord's Test: Shubman Gill's decision to bring on part-time pacer Nitish Kumar Reddy paid off on Day 1 at Lord's. England lost two wickets in the same over on Thursday.

Just happens with me man: Rishabh Pant reacts to his flying bat anticsRishabh Pant commented on his flying bat antics as the Indian vice-captain lost grip of his willow twice during the Edgbaston Test. Pant has been one of the top scorers in the ongoing series against England.

Who is Laurent Mekies? Red Bull boss who replaces Christian Horner?Red Bull shocked the Formula 1 world on July 9 by sacking Christian Horner. Horner, who was at the position for nearly two decades was replaced by Laurent Mekies.

Sachin Tendulkar portrait unveiled at Lord's: Artist reveals stunning detailsSachin Tendulkar's portrait was unveiled at Lord's, marking a memorable day for the cricket legend. The artwork was created by Stuart Pearson Wright from a photograph he took at his home 18 years ago.

Indian football in chaos: Slips from 126 to 133 in latest FIFA rankingsIndia slipped seven places in the latest FIFA world rankings, falling to 133, their worst position since 2017. The drop comes after a poor run of form and the recent departure of head coach Manolo Marquez.

Edgbaston effect? England take rare call to bat 1st under BazballEngland captain Ben Stokes chose to bat first against India at Lord's in a rare move. This was only the second time in 3 years that Stokes won the toss and put England to bat first in home conditions.

Lord's Test: Jasprit Bumrah back after Shubman Gill loses hat-trick of tossesEngland vs India, 3rd Test: Shubman Gill lost the toss in England for the third straight time. Ben Stokes called it right and opted to bat on a bright morning in London. Jasprit Bumrah replacing Prasidh Krishna was the lone change for India.

Djokovic does 'Pump It Up' dance with kids after sealing 14th Wimbledon semisNovak Djokovic reached his 14th Wimbledon semi-final, but it was his fun 'Pump It Up' dance with his kids after the win that stole the show and melted hearts on Centre Court.

3rd Test, Day 1 Stumps: England close first day at 251/4India (IND) vs England (ENG), 3rd Test, Day 1 Live Updates: Joe Root and Ben Stokes remained unbeaten at the end of day's play at Lord's. Root anchored England's innings and helped them score 251 runs, losing 4 wickets in the process. Nitish Kumar Reddy was the most successful bowler from the Indian camp, picking up 2 wickets to his name.

Lord's Test: Jofra Archer tipped to make Pat Cummins-esque returnEngland vs India: Steve Harmison has tipped Jofra Archer to make a Pat Cummins-esque return to Test cricket after being back in the England red-ball lineup for the first time in 4 years. Archer will play in the Lord's Test against India.

IPL ticket scam: CID arrests Hyderabad cricket chief Jagan Mohan Rao, 4 othersThe Crime Investigation Department (CID) on Wednesday arrested Hyderabad Cricket Association (HCA) President A. Jagan Mohan Rao in connection with a ticketing scandal during the 2025 Indian Premier League (IPL) season.

How Sunil Gavaskar escaped becoming a good fisherman and bad batsmanSunil Gavaskar was mistakenly swapped with another baby at birth in the hospital. His uncle noticed the missing birthmark on his ear and alerted the family just in time. Had his uncle not noticed, Gavaskar might have grown up a good fisherman and a bad batsman.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
